timeline.bodyText: I think the Java version discussion is fine.  I'm not sure about saying that fully supported "means that problems found will be fixed or addressed in other means"; we don't always do that.  Could we change that last sentence to focus on something like "If you encounter a problem while using a Java version that is considered 'best-effort' by JMRI, people may not be able to fix any problems you encounter unless you install a fully-supported Java version" or something like that?
